meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of lignite.
meanings.sent1: The lignitic rock had a dark color and a woody texture.
meanings.sent2: The lignitic soil in the area made it difficult for plants to grow.
meanings.sent3: The lignitic coal was so old, it told jokes to the other rocks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as lignitic as the ancient tree bark.
meanings.sent5: The lignitic smell of the burning wood filled the room.

meanings.sent1: The lignitic layers in the ground indicated a history of ancient forests.
meanings.sent2: The lignitic appearance of the fossilized leaf amazed the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The lignitic rock looked like a piece of burnt toast.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a lignitic shine, reminiscent of a coal mine.
meanings.sent5: The lignitic pattern on the stone resembled tree rings.

meanings.sent1: The lignitic composition of the rock made it valuable for fuel.
meanings.sent2: The lignitic nature of the material made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent3: The lignitic cake was so dark, it seemed to absorb all the light around it.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a lignitic quality, deep and rich like the earth.
meanings.sent5: The lignitic texture of the artifact felt rough and ancient to the touch.
